page.title: 11PUBLICAN'S DAUGHTER
page.content: My parents run the Three King's: Jack's Booth Public House on the corner of the A4 and the road to Sulhamstead. Being the daughter of a publian is guaranteed to make your life different from most other people's. Sometimes you feel as you have a continuous party going on in your living room. It can sometimes be fun, but sometimes be so irritating that you wish you lived in a house on an estate without a pub in sight. During the week my mornings are very much the same as anyone else's, but in the evenings I might find myself helping in the kitchen or elsewhere in the pub. It has been difficult to share my family and my life with an endless stream of people. It is hard to accept that their leisure time is my work time. TRACEY TAMPSETT AGED 14.
